## GAD-7 vs RSES

GAD-7 vs RSES In psychological and social research, one of the persistent challenges is the comparison of different test instrument items. Such is the case when comparing the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale (RSES), both of which play crucial roles in understanding an individual's mental wellbeing. GAD-7, focusing on the severity of an individual's generalised anxiety disorder symptoms, and RSES, designed to evaluate a person's self-esteem, both come with unique elements that need thorough comparisons to draw substantial conclusions. Here, the innovative software, Harmony, easily facilitates the comparison of GAD-7 vs RSES. Leveraging on generative AI models and natural language processing, Harmony is talented at harmonising questionnaire items, such as those found in GAD-7 and RSES, in an easy and fast fashion. Traditionally, harmonisation is a demanding process, however, with Harmony, this is simply not the case. Harmony makes comparison possible not just within these two instruments, but across diverse studies. With its extensive database, Harmony allows researchers to select the instruments they prefer, compare and even upload their own in PDF form. Thus, GAD-7 vs RSES analysis is made easier, leading to better research outcomes. Another superior benefit of Harmony lies in its multilingual capacity. Yes, you heard it right; Harmony can compare items in multiple languages! This feature escalates the benefits of comparisons like GAD-7 vs RSES beyond any language boundaries. Making full use of longitudinal and cohort studies possible, Harmony reaffirms the consistency of results or illuminates differences in response to changing social conditions. So remember, the next time you're stuck with the comparison of GAD-7 vs RSES, turn to Harmony.

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RSES into Harmony</a> - compare RSES with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
